snippet: Jared L. Loughner, the defendant in the Tucson shooting, is set to plead guilty Tuesday, bringing an abrupt resolution to a case that seemed ensnarled in doubts over his competence to stand trial.
abstract: Jared L Loughner is set to plead guilty to the Tuscon, Ariz, shooting rampage that left six people dead and 13 wounded, including Rep Gabrielle Giffords; plea will allow Loughner to avert the death penalty, bringing an abrupt resolution to a case that seemed ensnarled in doubts over his competence to stand trial.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Steven Lee Myers and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, and Sarah Garrecht Gassen from Tucson.

lead_paragraph: Jared L. Loughner, the defendant in the Tucson shooting, is set to plead guilty Tuesday, bringing an abrupt resolution to a case that seemed ensnarled in doubts over his competence to stand trial.

headline.seo: Jared Loughner’s Competence Was Linchpin in Tucson Rampage Case
headline.main: Competence Was Linchpin for Both Sides in Tucson Case
headline.print_headline: Competence Was Linchpin For Both Sides In Tucson Case
